Key Match Events: The Celtics dominated in points in the paint, scoring 60 compared to the Nuggets' 46.
Kristaps Porziņģis played arguably his best game for the season, recording 25 points on 9-for-18 shooting from the field, 11 rebounds, two steals, and a block.
Pre-Game Insights: Many thought it wasn't a plan they'd go to, but due to the absence of the Nuggets superstar center Nikola Jokic, things switched things up for Boston.
The Celtics decided to live and die in the paint.
Post-Match Reflections: Head coach Joe Mazzulla raved about his star big man Kristaps Porziņģis after the game.
Joe Mazzulla said of Porzingis, 'He was big-time tonight at both ends of the floor.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics, who are known for their three-point prowess, only attempted 35 3-pointers (its second-lowest total of the season) and made just 12.
The Celtics will need Porziņģis out on the court as we enter the playoffs.
Others: Porziņģis has struggled this season with staying healthy and returning on the court after returning from offseason leg surgery in late November, and has only played in 14 of Boston's 37 games.

Porziņģis has been great while on the court, averaging 18.3 points per game, 6.8 rebounds, 1.7 assists, and 1.4 blocks while shooting 45.7 percent from the field and 32.9 percent from three in 27.9 minutes of action.
